article:
{{Multiple issues|primarysources = August 2011|self-published = August 2011|

}}

'Embase' is an online information source of published literature designed to
support information managers and pharmacovigilance in complying with the
regulatory requirements of a licensed drug. Through its unique and comprehensive
content coverage, frequent updates, and deep drug indexing, Embase enables
tracking and precise retrieval of drug adverse events in the published
literature. Embase is produced by Elsevier and contains over 25 million records
from 1947 to the present. Each record is fully indexed and Articles
in Press are available for some records and In Process are available for all
records, ahead of full indexing. Embase covers over 7,600 biomedical journals
from 90 countries and it is available online through a number of database
vendors. [http://www.elsevier.com/wps/product/cws_home/523328 Embase],
Elsevier
